post.author: 권칠환
post.content:
Hi all,   I’ll send out an announcement shortly for the next Toronto .NET User group on Thursday January 29th (mark your calendar).  But in the meantime, join us next Saturday for the SharePoint Camp!!  It will be held at Manulife downtown which is near Church and Bloor (full directions on the site).   It is an AMAZING day of speakers and content!!



“It is that time of year again.....the Toronto SharePoint Camp is Saturday, January 24th!

If you haven’t registered yet, please do so ASAP by going to the website http://www.torontosharepointcamp.com, and forward this email and link to anyone you know who is interested in learning how to do more with SharePoint.  The Toronto SharePoint Camp is organized by the Toronto SharePoint User Group and is about the administrative user and developer communities at large. It is meant to be a place for administrators and developers to come and learn from their peers.



Topics for this years’ Toronto SharePoint Camp were based on community interest and never determined by anyone other than the community......and....it is a FREE event.



Some of the topics for the 2009 camp include.:

Integrating SQL Server with MOSS

Social Computing with SharePoint and Silverlight (from non linear’s MS Team Lead, Andy Nogueira)

Advanced InfoPath Development with SharePoint

MOSS Search: Why it’s not enough to just turn it on



It should be a great turnout – we are expecting at least 300 ppl this year – up 20% from last years camp.



If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact Susie Ibbotson at sibbotson@nonlinear.ca



Ed Musters

President, Toronto .NET User Group
post.title: Toronto SharePoint Camp - Saturday January 24th
